text: Johann Georg Wenrich (lithograph (ca. 1830) Johann Georg Wenrich (13 October 1787, in Schäßburg – 15 May 1847, in Vienna) was an Austrian orientalist and theologian. He worked as a schoolteacher at the Evangelical gymnasium in Hermannstadt, where he later served as school director. In 1821 he was named professor of Biblical literature at the faculty of Protestant theology at the University of Vienna.Wenrich, Johann in: Allgemeine Deutsche Biographie 41 (1896), S. 724-725. He is credited with giving the first lectures on Sanskrit at the university.Allgemeine Realencyclopaedie oder Conversationslexikon, Volume 10 by Wilhelm I Binder In 1847 he was appointed to the Academy of Sciences in Vienna (Kaiserliche Akademie der Wissenschaften in Wien), however, he died on May 15, before he had received news of the honor. == Selected works == * Johann Wächter, als Mensch, als Diener des Staates und der Kirche (biography of Johann Wächter), (1831). * De auctorum Graecorum versionibus et commentariis Syriacis, Arabicis, Armeniacis Persicisque commentatio, (1842). * De poeseos Hebraicae atque Arabicae origine, indole, mutuoque consensu atque discrimine commentatio, (1843). * Rerum ab Arabibus in Italia insulisque adjacentibus, Sicilia maxime, Sardinia atque Corsica gestarum commentarii, (1845).HathiTrust Digital Library (published works)OCLC WorldCat (published works) == References == Category:1787 births Category:1847 deaths Category:People from Sighișoara Category:University of Vienna faculty Category:Austrian Protestant theologians Category:Austrian orientalists
